orderType.description:
Standard order is a quantity-based purchase order. It specifies quantity amounts, prices and desired delivery dates for the items or services. 
Standard purchase orders typically require goods receipts.

Blanket order is a sum-based long-term purchase order. It is placed for items or services for a specific period of time (validity period) 
and with an pre-determined maximum currency amount. Blanket orders are typically used for recurring invoices, for example ordering office cleaning 
for one year. They can be used for ordering both services and consumable goods. Quantity amount used on the blanket order is always '1'. 
Goods receipts are not used with blanket orders.

anyOf.description: Specifies, if all price information is hidden from the supplier in the outgoing purchase order.

externalCode.description: External document identifier that is used as a key in API. This number must be unique in Basware P2P, and cannot be updated after the first import.

purpose.example: To Replace 3 years old laptop according to company policy.

anyOf.description: HeaderDataText1-5: Can be used for for customer-specific text fields.
HeaderDataDate1-5: Can be used for for customer-specific date fields.
Indicates if the requisition is automatically sent to approval process. If false, requisition is saved as draft.
A custom identifier for the buyer organization, as defined in Basware P2P Administration. Alternatively, organizationUnitCode can be used. Both cannot be used simultaneously.

extDocumentNumber.description: Requisition document number from an external system. Needs to be unique. This is visible and searchable in Basware Purchase.

lines.description:
Notes: 
1) The requisition must contain at least one line, and can contain up to 200 lines. 
2) When Basware P2P creates the requisition it numbers the lines internally based on their order in the JSON. 
3) All lines on the requisition must have the same currencyCode. 
4) At least one line must contain a positive Quantity value. 
5) Total price for each requisition line is calculated by Basware P2P from the quantity, unit price, and applicable taxes and discounts.
6) All supplierCodes stated on requisition lines needs to exist in P2P as valid supplier. These suppliers needs to have an ordering method defined in P2P (else requisition will be imported with empty supplier). Suppliers using email ordering method need also to have a valid ordering email defined.

anyOf.description:
Login username for the requisition owner. The user must have 'Use Basware Purchase' user right. 
Users with Use restricted/simplified Basware Purchase user rights are invalid.
End date when goods/services are expected to be delivered.
Used only if the order type is blanket to specify, if the blanket purchase order requires release orders.
Used only if the order type is blanket to specify the end date for blanket purchase order validity period (date format: yyyy-MM-dd).
The code that identifies the buyer organization, as defined in Basware P2P Administration. Alternatively, organizationIdentifier can be used. Both cannot be used simultaneously.
Date when goods/services are expected to be delivered.
HeaderDataNum1-5: Can be used for for customer-specific numeric fields.
Used only if the order type is blanket to specify the start date for blanket purchase order validity period (date format: yyyy-MM-dd).

DeliveryAddress.description:
Specifies delivery address for the purchase requisition. If no address specified, uses the default delivery address of organization (configured in P2P).
Delivery address on header level applies to entire purchase reuisition. If addresses are also provided on requisition lines, these will apply only to the corresponding lines.

name.description: Specifies the addressâ€™ name for the goods delivery.

anyOf.description: Cost center code. If empty, the requisition owner's default cost center is used.
DimName1-10 is used for additional, customer-specific, coding dimensions. Specifies the dimension name.

externalCode.description: The coding row number in the external system.

anyOf.description: Defines a code for the budget.
Employee name. If empty, defaults to requisition owner's name.
Defines code for the account. If empty, defaults based on item's purchasing category.
Text1-5 are custom fields in the business document.
Defines name for the account. If empty, defaults based on the item's purchasing category.
Employee code. If empty, defaults to requisition owner's employee code.
Account assignment category code. If empty, defaults based on the item's purchasing category.
Num1-5 are custom fields in the business document.
Date1-5 are custom fields in the business document.
DimCode1-10 are often used for additional, customer-specific, coding dimensions. Specifies the dimension code.
Account assignment category name. If empty, defaults based on the item's purchasing category.
Email address used to override the default supplier email address, when orderRecipientType is Supplier or SupplierAndOwner.
LineDataNum1-5 can be used for customer-specific numeric fields. This data will go to â€˜Line dataâ€™ -tab of the requisition line in P2P.
LineDataDate1-5 can be used for customer-specific date fields. This data will go to â€˜Line dataâ€™ -tab of the requisition line in P2P.

externalCode.description: External identifier that is used as a key in API for the requisition line.

anyOf.description: LinePricingNum1-5 can be used for customer-specific numeric fields. This data will go to â€˜Pricingâ€™ -tab of the requisition line in P2P.
LineDataText1-5 can be used for customer-specific text fields. This data will go to â€˜Line dataâ€™ -tab of the requisition line in P2P.
Defines the tax percent. If empty, Basware P2P resolves the value using the tax percent from the purchasing category.
Each requisition line can have only one coding row.
Price for a single unit without discount. Price type (Net / Gross) is specified in field 'priceType'.
Identifier for the agreed delivery term for the item. If empty, supplier's delivery term is used.
Defines name for the tax code. If empty, Basware P2P resolves the value using the tax percent from the purchasing category.

Contact email to which supplier can send questions about the order. Note: When order is sent to supplier, it is not sent to this email. Note: Fields visible on the order sent to supplier are configured in P2P Purchase.
Indicates if the goods can be automatically received by Basware P2P on behalf of the user. If empty, defaults to false.
Second tax percent. Used for example for handling reverse charges on EU VAT.
LinePricingDate1-5 can be used for customer-specific date fields. This data will go to â€˜Pricingâ€™ -tab of the requisition line in P2P.
LinePricingText1-5 can be used for customer-specific text fields. This data will go to â€˜Pricingâ€™ -tab of the requisition line in P2P.

A code to identify the supplier. The code must match a valid supplier for the organization, or it will be emptied during import. 
If the purchase order is a self-service order and the supplier is invalid, the import will fail.

The email address(es) where the order is sent by P2P purchase. Can contain multiple email addresses separated by semicolon. The order is sent to these addresses when orderRecipientType is 'Owner' or 'Both'.

Identifier for the agreed payment term to be used when supplier charges the customer. 
If empty, defaults to the supplier's payment term.
Defines how many items a customer wants to purchase. The quantity must contain a positive value.

extRequisitionLineNumber.description: The requisition line number in the external system. The value must be unique for each line on the requisition.

priceType.description: Defines if the unit price stated is net (0) or gross (1). If empty, defaults to net (0).

anyOf.description:
Code for the item's purchasing category. The code must match a valid, active purchasing category for the organization. 
If invalid, the field will be emptied during import.

The United Nations Standard Products and Services Code, a unique 8-digit number used to identify trade items, products, and services. 
The value can also be used to match order lines to invoice lines. If empty, resolved by Basware P2P using the item's categoryCode.
A code that identifies purchased items for internal reporting and communication.

orderRecipientType.description:
Determines who order is sent to.
-Supplier(0) : Order is sent only to supplier.
-If orderingMethod is email, order is sent to the email indicated by 'supplierOrderingEmail'. -If orderingMethod is network, the order is sent through Basware network.
-Owner (1): Order is sent only to email address(es) indicated by field 'otherOrderingEmail'. Used for example when goods were picked up from a store and no order needs to be sent to supplier.
-SupplierAndOwner (2): Order is sent to both supplier and email addresses indicated by field 'otherOrderingEmail'. Order delivery method to supplier is determined by orderingMethod, same as above.

anyOf.description: Desired date the goods are to be delivered.
Indicates if the partial delivery of goods is allowed. If empty, defaults to false.

currencyCode.description:
A code that identifies the currency of the price on the line. All requisition lines must have the same currency code. 
If the code is different from the organization's currency, an exchange rate must exist for both codes in Basware P2P Administration, or the import will fail.
